title: about P-R curve provided in the readme
body:
hi, @Cartucho thanks for you contribution, it do help me a lot with understanding the criteria metric of PASCOL VOC 2012!

I have a similar question to #93 but not exact same. As you provided curve in the readme file:

![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15831541/43008995-64dd53ce-8c34-11e8-8a2c-4567b1311910.png)

Considering the first prediction entry is false positive, thus:
```
precision = TP/(TP+FP) = 0/(0+1) = 0
recall = TP/(TP+FN) = 0/(0+some constant) = 0
```
then the most left point is [0,0] in the P-R plane, for the second point, it seems that it is a correct prediction, thus:
```
precision = TP/(TP+FP) = 1/(1+1) = 0.5
recall = TP/(TP+FN) = 1/(1+some constant) = some value larger than 0
```
so it should **not** has a precision of 1, right?

**the point is, once the precision falls from 1, it can never get back.**
